intro: Ajania parviflora, commonly known as the smallflower ajania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its small, white to pinkish flowers bloom in spring, and the leaves are usually narrow and grass-like. Ajania parviflora is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
